basics.name: Miron Suarez
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

work.summary: Inspecting, servicing, troubleshooting, and ensuring the overall readiness and safety of the aircraft on the ground before, during, and after missions
highlights: Ensure compliance with technical orders, safety regulations, and mission requirements
Lead, train, and mentor junior airmen in aircraft maintenance procedures
Document, track, and report aircraft status using official maintenance systems
Collaborate with pilots, maintenance teams, and support personnel to ensure mission success

work.summary: Conducts detailed inspections, coordinating with specialists, Running operational checks to maintain operational safety, reliability, and mission readiness.
highlights: Inspect and service engines, hydraulics, fuel, and environmental systems for safe operation
Perform detailed checks of flight controls, landing gear, and avionics systems
Identify, troubleshoot, and coordinate corrective actions for maintenance discrepancies
Service and replenish consumables including oil, hydraulic fluid, oxygen, and nitrogen

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
